result.execSummary:
The defendant Hannah L. Novy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Hannah L. Novy is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Hannah L. Novy was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Hannah L. Novy was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: RCSD Dispo of Warrant or Commitment

Defendant Hannah L. Novy in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Def is before the Court for sentencing after revocation of probation in Count 3 of this case (bail jumping count); other count was an imposed/stayed sentence.  Sentence: 65 days jail, concurrent with count 1, with huber. Credit: 31 days.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 19, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Atty. Lisa McDougal has been appointed. Clerk is working with counsel re scheduling.
Probation is being revoked for both Counts 1 and 3; return to court required for sentencing on Count 3 only as Count 1's sentence was already imposed.
Per phone call from place of employment, HN is no longer employed there (PPF).
Payment Plan Due Date Summary (Remailed to same address. Phone call to HN-this is her current address. She will contact post office)

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Hannah L. Novy in court with attorney David E Saperstein. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  4 cases called together:  14CM98, 14CT38, 15CM67 and 15CM45.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution.  Agreement calls for def's pleas to count 1/OWI 2nd in 14CM98, count 1/OWI 3rd (after amendment upward), and count 3/bail jumping for 15CM45; remaining counts and cases to be dismissed/read-in.

Def pleads no contest to the three charges stated.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Def takes probation disposition option.  Court sentences as follows:

14CM98 - $350 plus costs, 10 days jail, 12 mo revocation, 12 mo IID upon relicensing, AODA/driver safety plan to be relicensed.  $66 blood draw cost - RCPD.

15CM45 - 65 days jail imposed/stayed for probation of 2 years on count 1.  Conditions:  14 days conditional jail time with good time and work release; $600 plus costs, 24 mo revocation, 24 mo IID, both concurrent with 14CM98.  Jail is consecutive to 14CM98.  AODA/driver safety plan to be relicensed.  $66 blood draw cost - RCPD.

Submit DNA sample at the RCSD before leaving the courthouse today, then sign up for probation.

Defense requests 1 week stay for def to begin jail term.  Court grants request - jail stayed until on or before Nov. 3 between 6-7 a.m.

Count 3 - 2 years probation - attend, pay for, and succ. complete any counseling/education/treatment as recommended by agent.

Remaining counts in these 2 cases dismissed.  Cases 15CM67 and 14CT38 dismissed/read in.

Atty. S was court-appointed.  Court orders def to reimburse Richland County for these costs; may be added to def's pay plan.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-27-2015 02:00 pm

4 cases called together for status:  14CT38, 15CM67, 15CM45, and 14CM98.  Defendant Hannah L. Novy not in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney David E Saperstein in court, by authorization, for Defendant Hannah L. Novy.  Atty. S states that the parties have reached a resolution; proposed agreement includes plea to both 2nd and 3rd OWI; as there will be an immediate report date, def wants to be able to make arrangements with employment.  Court sets for Oct. 27 at 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference at 09-30-2015 02:30 pm

Defendant Hannah L. Novy not in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney David E Saperstein in court, by authorization, for Defendant Hannah L. Novy.  Several cases called together for status:  15CM45, 14CT38, 14CM98, and 15CM67.  Atty. Saperstein requests further status.  So ordered.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
to Appear

14CT38, 15CM67, 14CM98, and 15CM45.  Defendant Hannah L. Novy not in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Status conference scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Hannah L. Novy in court with attorney David E Saperstein. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Initial appearance conducted in 15CM67 and status in 14CM45, 14CM98, and 14CT38.  NG pleas have been entered in all matters.  Atty. Saperstein addresses Court re bond curfew conditions in 15CM67; asks for elimination or tayloring of that condition due to def's work schedule.  Court notes that def was agreeable to those conditions at the time of the bail hrg.  Atty. S suggests def be in her home from midnight to 6 a.m.  ADA doesn't object but cautions def to ensure she honors the deal.  Court makes amendment to bond to change curfew to midnight-6 a.m.

All matters set for status June 24th at 3:30 p.m.  Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
